comments.body: I'm confused why we have both ParseWatchResourceVersion and ParseListResourceVersion... they differ only in the type of error they return. That means they only differ in error cases, not in what they return that should be passed to helper.Watch(), right? It seems really odd that a resource version would be parsed differently depending on the intended use.
I believe it is the input that differs. I agree the error handling is weird, but I'd like that fixed in another PR; this one is not changing any behavior.
I made the errors consistent, but if it causes any test failures I'll change it back.

> I believe it is the input that differs. I agree the error handling is weird, but I'd like that fixed in another PR; this one is not changing any behavior.

if the transformation is consistent (which it is, and must be since the resourceVersion from a list response is fed into a watch request), then it will work for any input. would like to see these collapsed to a single `ParseResourceVersion`, but a follow up is fine.
